importantDates.descriptionOfWhyDateIsRelevant: The date when the article was published and the TikTok drama involving Sombr and Meg became publicly known.

keyTakeAways: Shane Boose, performing under the stage name Sombr, gained viral popularity with singles like 'Back to Friends' and 'Undressed'.
A TikTok user named Meg, aged 25, posted a scathing review of Sombr’s concert at The Anthem in Washington, DC, calling it one of the worst experiences of her life.
Meg criticized the concert for having an overwhelmingly young audience, immature humor, and inappropriate jokes, including a sketch involving participants calling their 'toxic exes'.

Sombr responded to the criticism, labeling it 'TikTok drama', stating that he is a 20-year-old artist and audiences should expect younger attendees, and that his jokes are light-hearted and not serious.
Sombr included a 'touch grass' tutorial in his response video, a common social media gesture signaling playful dismissal.
Meg stated she has never received such intense backlash from a single post, especially compared to her previous political content.
The incident highlights tensions between artistic expression, audience expectations, and social media discourse.

summaryOfNewsArticle: Shane Boose, known professionally as Sombr, gained popularity through viral singles like 'Back to Friends' and 'Undressed'. A 25-year-old TikTok user named Meg criticized Sombr’s concert at The Anthem in Washington, DC, calling it one of the worst experiences of her life due to an overly young audience, immature humor, and inappropriate jokes including a sketch involving participants calling their 'toxic exes'. Sombr responded by calling the situation 'TikTok drama', emphasizing that he is a 20-year-old artist and that his jokes are light-hearted and part of a short, playful segment. He also used the 'touch grass' gesture to signal playful dismissal. Meg noted the intense backlash she received, which she finds unusual compared to her political content. The incident underscores tensions between artistic expression, audience expectations, and social media discourse.
title: Sombr’s TikTok Drama May Not Be Something You Know About, But Your Kids Probably Do
